paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses a case of late-onset hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis associated with the TTR gene variant Val30Met.

patients.phenotype: late-onset hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis, familial amyloid polyneuropathy, cardiac amyloidosis

individual_records.phenotype_details: progressive numbness, pain and weakness in limbs, sweating, constipation, unexplained weight loss, cardiac involvement
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A missense mutation c. 148 G-A Val30Met (p.Val50Met) was detected in TTR gene sequencing.
Recently, the patient’s first son developed limb numbness and found the same TTR gene abnormality.

functional_data.summary: The variant causes TTR tetramers to destabilize and dissociate into variant TTR monomers that form amyloid fibrils.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: The patient had a family history of limb numbness and systemic edema.
key_quotes: The genetic finding confirmed hATTR Val30Met, familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP) and CA for the patient.

tables_processed.table_caption: Gene Sequencing Revealed TTR Gene Missense Mutation

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the variant was clearly described in the text.
